item.title: You can now store PS5 games on a USB drive
item.description: Sony is rolling out the first major PS5 system update on April 14th, and it adds support for storing the new console's games on USB drives.

item.title: Facebook's Portal+ smart display is on sale for $200 right now
item.description: Save big on Facebook's Portal+ smart display at QVC, where you can get it for 29 percent off.

item.title: Google is working to bring Sony's 360 Reality Audio to Android
item.description: Google could be working with Sony to integrate 360 Reality Audio into its Android software.

item.title: Dell's refreshed Inspiron line includes a 16-inch laptop
item.description: In addition to the typical performance upgrades we see every year, the company is also unveiling the Inspiron 16 Plus

item.title: Roku unveils an Express 4K+ set-top box and its first rechargeable remote
item.description: Roku's entry-level streaming box is getting a 4K upgrade: the $40 Roku Express 4K+. And it's finally unveiling a rechargeable voice remote.

item.title: Spotify's voice-controlled 'Car Thing' is available for some subscribers
item.description: Spotify admitted its voice-controlled in-car streaming player existed in 2019. Now you might have a chance to actually use it.

item.title: Microsoft's Surface Laptop 4 features 11th-gen Intel CPUs
item.description: Almost a year and a half since launching the Surface Laptop 3, Microsoft is finally ready with a follow-up. The Surface Laptop 4 continues the line's tradition of being, well, kind of basic.

item.title: Microsoft's new 'Modern' accessories include its first webcam in years
item.description: Microsoft is launching a range of new workplace-oriented accessories, including a webcam and Surface Headphones 2+, that are certified to work with Teams.

item.title: Roku's OS 10 brings AirPlay 2 and HomeKit support to its HD streaming devices
item.description: Roku has started rolling out its latest operating system, and it will gives its HD streaming devices AirPlay 2 and HomeKit compatibility.

item.title: Dell's XPS 13 now comes with an optional $300 OLED display
item.description: Starting today, you can pay an extra $300 on the price of the Full HD model to configure a new XPS 13 with a 3,456 x 2,160 OLED panel.

item.title: Facebook's Oversight Board will consider appeals to remove content
item.description: Facebook's Oversight Board now accepts appeals to remove content, not just restore it.

item.title: The Morning After: Even NASA’s Mars drone needs software updates
item.description: Today’s headlines: Domino’s starts making autonomous pizza deliveries, Apple is reportedly working on a speaker with Apple TV built-in and NASA’s Mars drone needed a software update.

item.title: OnePlus Watch review: Just get a Fitbit instead
item.description: OnePlus is promising a week’s worth of juice in just 20 minutes. And its $159 price tag is another pro. But with a brand new OS and little else unique, the OnePlus Watch struggles to hold its own against the competition.

item.title: Canon's mirrorless EOS R3 leaks with a 1D-like pro body
item.description: Prolific (and generally accurate) camera leaker Nokishita has just tweeted an image that appears to show an EOS R3 camera.

item.title: Northrop's servicing robot extends the life of an orbiting satellite by five years
item.description: Northrop Grumman's Mission Extension Vehicle-2 clamped onto Intelsat's IS-10-02 communications satellite and extended its lifespan by five years.

item.title: Siri says Apple will hold a special event on April 20th
item.description: Apple's virtual assistant Siri seems to have let slip the official date of its upcoming event where it's expected to reveal a new iPad pro.

item.title: Blue Origin's 15th New Shepard test flight serves as an astronaut rehearsal
item.description: The launch window for New Shepard's 15th test flight opens on April 14th, 9AM Eastern time. That particular test, aptly codenamed NS-15, will serve as a verification step for the vehicle and its operations prior to flying astronauts to suborbital space.

item.title: NASA's Mars copter needs a software update ahead of its flight test
item.description: The Ingenuity copter should be ready to fly on Mars after it downloads an update... from 174 million miles away.

item.title: Watch NVIDIA's GTC keynote in 17 minutes
item.description: Come for Jensen's hair, stay for all of NVIDIA's chip announcements.

item.title: The FCC wants to know how fast your internet connection is
item.description: The FCC has had a speed test app since 2013, but under Acting Chair Jessica Rosenworcel it's asking that more Americans download and use the software.

item.title: Oculus will host its first games showcase on April 21st
item.description: Expect updates on 'Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy’s Edge' and 'Pistol Whip.'

item.title: The Google Play video app will leave Roku, Vizio, LG and Samsung's TV platforms
item.description: Google is discontinuing the Google Play Movies and TV app for Samsung, LG and Vizio smart TVs, as well as Roku devices.

item.title: Intel wants to make chips for automakers to help with the global shortage
item.description: Intel has laid out a plan to help automakers dealing with the global semiconductor shortage that has left companies like GM canceling production shifts.

item.title: Google's Nest Audio smart speaker is 20 percent off across the web
item.description: Google's Nest Audio is on sale for $20 off at many online retailers, including Best Buy and Walmart.

item.title: Apple's iPad mini drops to $345 at Amazon
item.description: Save big the iPad mini -- Apple's tiny tablet is $55 off at Amazon right now.
